intro: Schivereckia contorta, commonly known as the spiral rush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its tightly coiled, spiral-shaped inflorescence, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in wet, marshy environments and has slender, grass-like leaves. Schivereckia contorta is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its unique appearance.
